name: Die Port van Cleve

reviews.text: I stayed here in 2003 and didn't book until we got into the city. Usually I will only book a 4 or 5 star, but was with a budget conscious friend so we did this 3 star. The rooms in the pictures didn't resemble the room we were given and I was very disappointed. It was super small, the bathroom was tiny and old with cracked tile floor. I will not stay here again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone unless it was super cheap and they didn't have as high of standards.
reviews.title: small drywall room
Good Location, Good Food
reviews.text: We got a special rate via Internet, otherwise I'd say the room was a little small for the price. However, it was comfortable, with spotless bathroom. The trams outside were a little noisy, but given the central location, excusable. Desk staff were all extremely helpful, restaurant food excellent (the traditional pea soup deserves a special mention) and staff good. The staff serving breakfast were all very young and would probably benefit from a little more training, but we were certainly not ignored, unlike one other client's comment I've seen on this web site. We would certainly return.

For the price this hotel is great for a weekend getaway. Perhaps not 4 star (as the debate rages) but how many 4 star hotels are available in the centre of an amazing city for $150 USD per night. The rooms were small but if you're going to hang out in your room then go to Gent! The breakfast buffett looked amazing but was too steep for me. There is coffee in the room and a fantastic bakery around the corner. Add in the 10 minute walk from the railway station and all in all a very good weekend.'
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Above Average Hotel
fine as long as you know what to expect
reviews.text: No, it's not a 4-star hotel. But if you can get a decent deal on a room, it's got a great location and is just fine. Our room was clean, we got fresh towels etc. every day, and the bathroom was quite nice. Breakfast was fine if not outstanding, and we decided to pay for the convenience.

reviews.title: Definately not a 4 Star Hotel
reviews.text: Tips: ask for an interior room. It's not right up against the street, so it's a little quieter. No view, but it seemed like a decent tradeoff since I don't usually gaze out the window of my hotel room while on vacation. Also, we found we had to wedge the window open (it swings open) when we left or the window would close and the room would get stuffy.
To sum up: I'd stay there again if the price was right. Overall, we liked the place, but having already visited TripAdvisor, we knew not to expect 4 star accommodations.

aka: Die Port Van Cleve Hotel Amsterdam
description: Hotel Die Port van Cleve is a famous Dutch hotel located directly behind the Royal Palace & facing Dam Square. Due its central location, you will find many touristic and cultural sites within walking distance. Hotel Die Port van Cleve has a rich history. Heineken opened its first brewery in this building in 1864. Brasserie ‘De Poort’ is famous for its numbered steaks and Bar-Bodega ‘De Blauwe Parade’ has an unique Delft blue tile fresco dating from 1887. At the beginning of 2012, rooms were soft refurbished and all rooms were redecorated with references to the authentic tile fresco in the bar.
